summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to the FBI, providing contact information and background on a potential victim/witness, an actress, for the Epstein investigation. The email authorizes the FBI to make initial contact and suggests arranging an in-person interview in California.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, providing information and authorization to the FBI to contact a potential victim/witness in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a perpetrator who met the potential victim while she was in high school; her mother claimed she 'narrowly escaped' him, but she is apparently one of his victims.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is investigating Epstein and coordinating with the FBI to contact potential victims.

events.title: FBI Interview Referenced
events.description: An FBI interview was conducted, documented in a 302 report dated 07/05/2013. The content mentions Epstein buying a cottage and that someone was a recruiter.

events.title: Planned Witness Contact
events.description: The prosecutor and FBI plan to contact and potentially interview a potential victim/witness, an actress, in California.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A potential victim/witness is an actress who was reportedly one of Epstein's victims, having met him while she was in high school.
Her mother has publicly stated she 'narrowly escaped' Epstein, but the prosecution believes she was actually a victim.
The individual has not previously been interviewed by law enforcement, and her name appears in only one FBI 302 report from 2013 (interview date 2011).
The FBI is authorized to make initial contact with the witness, with plans for prosecutors to meet her in person in California.
The 302 report mentions Epstein bought a cottage in a location possibly called 'Malubi' and references a recruiter.
